attributes.action: Commission the Crown Prosecution Service to investigate and prosecute reckless and negligant bankers for their behaviour, rather than pay them bonuses funded by tax payers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The recklessness and greed of bankers has done more damage to, and financially cost the UK economy far more than a terrorist attack ever could.  Thousands have lost their jobs and homes as a result.  Instead of the taxpayer subsidising banker's bonuses, the bankers involved should be investigated, and where appropriate (and where ever possible) prosecuted and punished for their recklessness and negligance.

rejection.details: The CPS must decide whether to prosecute a criminal case based on its individual merits, following a police investigation. See more information here: http://www.cps.gov.uk/about/principles.html
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
